title: APIs.guru
description: Our goal is to create a machine-readable Wikipedia for WEB APIs. If you have an API definition in any format (OpenAPI, RAML, WADL, API Blueprint etc) for any public API, please, feel free to open an issue.

projects.title: GraphQL Voyager
projects.description: Represent any GraphQL API as an interactive graph üõ∞Ô∏è
projects.longDescription:
With graphql-voyager you can visually explore your GraphQL API as an interactive graph.
This is a great tool when designing or discussing your data model. It includes multiple
example GraphQL schemas and also allows you to connect it to your own GraphQL endpoint.
What are you waiting for, explore your API!

projects.title: GraphQL Faker
projects.description: Mock or extend your GraphQL API with faked data. No coding required. üé≤
projects.longDescription:
Mock your future API or extend the existing API with realistic data from faker.js.
No coding required. All you need is to write GraphQL IDL. Don't worry, we will
provide you with examples in our IDL editor.

projects.title: GraphQL Lodash
projects.description: Data manipulation for GraphQL queries with lodash syntax üõ†
projects.longDescription:
Data manipulation for GraphQL queries with lodash syntax.
GraphQL allows to ask for what you need and get exactly that. But what about the
shape? GraphQL Lodash gives you the power of lodash right inside your GraphQL
Query using @_ directive.

projects.title: OpenAPI Directory
projects.description: Wikipedia for Web APIs. Directory of REST API specs in OpenAPI(fka Swagger) 2.0 format.

projects.title: Public GraphQL APIs
projects.description: A collective list of public GraphQL APIs. The repository also links unofficial API proxies.

projects.title: generator-openapi-repo
projects.description: Yeoman generator for OpenAPI/Swagger repo to help you share spec for your API
